name: Bloons TD Battles
description: Go head to head with other players in a Bloon-popping battle for victory. From the creators of best-selling Bloons TD 5, this all new Battles game is specially designed for multiplayer combat, featuring the ability to control bloons directly and send them charging past your opponent's defenses.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 (32 & 64bit) Processor: 1.5Ghz or better Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: OpenGL 2.0 Storage: 512 MB available space Sound Card: Windows compatible sound card
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7, 8 or 10 Processor: 2Ghz or better Memory: 1024 MB RAM Graphics: OpenGL 2.0 compatible, ATI, Nvidia or Intel HD Storage: 512 MB available space Sound Card: Windows compatible sound card

reviews.review_text: I'm suprised that BTD Battles actually made it to Steam, and It works very well.  Although, it dosen't seem anymore different to the Mobile edition with some exceptions, such as a monkey hand for a cursor, using 1,2,3, etc. for hotkeys, upgrading ( , and . ) and some other features. I remember when BTD Battles came out for FLASH, and everyone USED to play it on the Ninja Kiwi website. Till it came out for mobile, than nobody played the Flash version.  I REALLY like you can play this with the players on Steam and on an iPad/Android, so you'll not have to wait about 20 seconds to fight someone (unless you have really bad connection, if so, you shouldn't play this game). And connecting to the Steam Cloud and the Ninja Kiwi Cloud, I found that really useful if you had a record before.  But of course, there are some problems.  I'm a bit dissapointed that if you want to have the best of BTD Battles, You'll need to pay for it, and the Club Rooms is a perfect example. I don't really wanna pay 5 USD (I'm Australian, so I'd have to pay more) just for new maps and different gamemodes.  And also slowly having to play for hours on end to unlock the best towers, it's gets quite frustrating that you want to unlock a 4th tier Bloonchipper, but if you're into the grinding genre of games, I guess it's alright...  Also, I would want to be able to customise hotkeys, but if that is not going to happen, it's ok, I guess. BUT there is no hotkeys to send out Bloons, and I'm REALLY used to do that. It's really weird.  Overall, I'm glad this went onto Steam, and I'll be playing it on Steam, the game itself is great, challenging and competitive. (I mostly wrote about the Steam and Mobile version and differences, sorry.) But I shouldn't be able to pay 6.40 AUD to have access to the more interesting features of the game. Also, Hotkeys. Give me dem hotkeys man.  EDIT: Oh god I went over this after 1 day, and this review is so so bad,
Basic Information

10/10 would nolife again.  Some would say that this game follows a pay to win model because either A) they ran out of medallions, or B) they got owned by someone with a trillion cobras and what not. If you run out of medals it's not that hard to get them back if you know how to rush properly especially. Nobody is forcing people to play battle arenas, anyway. I also saw a few reviews claiming to get towers it was a massive grind, however even as a noob to the game I managed to grind out all the towers (minus the t4 I don't use ever) in about 6 or 7 hours. To me this isn't very bad, but then again I also enjoy mmo grinds. Anyway, if you're looking to burn some time and don't mind putting in a bit of effort to learn the game, it's a great pick!

This is a very fun game. It has a unique competitive twist where you throw balloons to kill the other player! What's not to love about throwing balloons at other players? Especially giant green and black ZOMGs that are probably making them scream 'oh crap, oh crap, oh crap.'

If you know anything about the Bloons series you know its fun. This game is no exception. Very solid TD. Build-Send balloons-upgrade and repeat. The multi-player seems to work properly. I'm not so sure about the 'club' thing or the in-game purchases but it doesn't seem to break the game. Anyways if you like Tower Defenses then you will like this game. Keep in mind it's mp only. Have fun! -Casey
Meh nice game good time waster but love it keep up the good work! recommended!

Bloons TD Battles is a great game but matchmaking takes ages and rarely ever finds people, even on the first battle arenas; my experiences on iOS/Android were much better. However, there are still some good things about the game like cloud saving, so you can play on the same account on multiple platforms and devices. But overall Bloons TD Battles is a very fun, gameplay-wise.

A different take on Bloons Tower defense, I'm really enjoying this game. All of the aspects of this game are quite enjoyable and it has the feel of the classic BTD games we all know and love. It's even built to be a co-op game by default, which is really cool- and it's cross platform. You don't get better than that. It's a very smooth-running game, where the graphics really don't matter. I definitely recommend it.

Pros:  -Classic BTD style gameplay (But only allowing 3-4 towers). -Multiplayer. -Quick to find matchs (a couple secs). -Good fps (hard to measure since I have a good pc, but never going below 60fps). -Strategy can beat power (people may have unlocked more tower upgrades, but with strategy, anyone can win).  Cons:  -Could be considered P2W (I think strategy can beat it though). -No graphics options. -Nothing really new to the actually content (Only really one tower that is really expensive). -Connection issues (some people will have bad connection making you play in slow-mo). -Hacking (I have heard of hacking, but never seen it).    There are a lot of cons, but don't take that as a bad thing since most of them won't affect you much.

Finally on Steam!   Compete with fellow monkeys while still fending off intelligent plastic balls. Make your own plastic balls, coat them with ceramic, put them in a blimp, and send them to murder your fellow opponent monkey. Or you could just use a leech/Cobra to slowly drain your opponent of his/her/its health  without sending a single bloon .  Fun and addicting. Doesn't lag much, even for someone with a useless computer like mine. Great gameplay, too.  Would be better if the chat options had a 'Thanks!' or 'Wow!' Also needs more towers, in two days I've unlocked every single tower (not all tiers, but still). Network needs optimization. Still a fair amount of hackers. Attrition cobra op. A few bugs.  Entertaining, but definitely has room for improvement.    Also, why's there a Trading subforum? This game has no items.
I love this game!

A great example or how to port a mobile or browser based game to steam. Don't charge for it, have support for keyboard and mouse, and don't have the microtransactions so bad that it's impossible to play without them. The only part I don't like so far are the club game modes. They add new rules and make the game more fun, but you have to pay for it. And you can only challenge friends to them. Overall a decent game.

good take on the Bloons franchise... except for the tons of poor UI limitations. - no replay function (you can't see what you did wrong or what your opponent did right). - lack of keybinds for sending balloons (the available keybinds are not even shown in-game) - poor use of screen real estate (probably because there's some mobile version) - tower descriptions often give insufficient info (price, attack speed, range, damage... all mostly missing) - bloon descriptions are pretty much completely missing in game - tower placement is still dependent on skillful mouse-pixelling; no snap-to-edge function - some towers require unnecessary micro: farms, gatling, etc - tower abilities don't allow targeting (and also have no keybinds) - incoming waves are neither described nor indicated  some gameplay elements are also not up to par for a multiplayer game: - no elo matching (it's pretty much a random matchup) - weirdly structured leaderboards (no way for newcomers to catch up without weeks of grind) - medal pricing is quite prohibitive for newcomers (be prepared to grind the first few days unless you git gud fast) - towers aren't very balanced (apprentice/ninja/buccaneer > almost every other tower)  all in all, if you enjoyed the bloon TD games, this is a pretty fun take allowing you to match against other players. at the very least, the game isn't P2W. well, you could pay to unlock towers more quickly, and that COULD help you win; but it only takes at most up until your first weekly reward to unlock most towers.  nonetheless, until they upgrade the UI substantially, this game will annoy the heck out of you and force you to read copious amounts of guides just to find out what towers do, which bloons to send when, and why certain waves + assault are so powerful. if you just want a casual versus game, might wanna look elsewhere.

This easy butter chicken recipe can be made in 35 minutes and is SUPER delicious. It's rich, creamy and addictive. It's also very easy to make dairy-free!    Makes: 4 servings   Ingredients 2 tablespoons grapeseed oil (or another neutral flavoured oil) 1 lb. chicken breast or tenders (see notes) 2 yellow onions, roughly chopped 3 tablespoons chopped ginger 6 garlic cloves, crushed 1 tablespoon garam masala 1 teaspoon ground turmeric 1 teaspoon coriander, ground or seeds 1 teaspoon cumin, ground or seeds ¼ teaspoon fenugreek, ground or seeds ¼ to 1 teaspoon chili powder Seeds from 4 cardamom pods 1 - 28-ounce can of crushed or diced tomatoes 2 tablespoons almond butter 2 tablespoons dairy or coconut cream 2-4 tablespoons brown sugar, to taste Optional: 2 tablespoons plain yogurt Sea salt, to taste (I like about 2 teaspoons)  1.Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a medium-sized frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the chicken breasts or tenders and cook, stirring frequently, until they are cooked through and no longer pink, about 12-15 minutes. Remove them from the pan and cut them into 1-inch chunks.  2.While the chicken is cooking begin preparing the sauce. Add the remaining tablespoon of oil to a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion starts to brown, about 10 minutes. Add the garlic and ginger and cook for 1 minute more.  3.Add all the spices all at once, or remove the pan from the heat for a moment while you add them. (garam masala, turmeric, coriander, cumin, fenugreek, chili powder and cardamom seeds) Let the spices cook for about one minute, or until they are quite fragrant. Add the tomatoes to the pan and scrape up any stuck on brown bits. Add half a cup of water and bring the pot to a boil. Lower the heat to medium and let the sauce simmer for 15 minutes.  4.Carefully add the sauce to your blender and blend on high until it is very smooth. Add the sauce back to the pan and stir through the almond butter, dairy or coconut cream and the optional yoghurt.  5.Serve with a side of rice.

Bloons TD Battles is a very fun an tower defence game which gives you a diffrent experience every match. You cant use the same strategy everyime you allways have to adapt to what the other player is doing otherwise you will most likely lose. There is many diffrent towers which have diffrent special abiltys that are all helpfull in their own way. There are also alot of fun diffrent maps which have their own layouts that force you to put ur towers in diffrent uses and lanes which might sound pretty obvious but this is my first 'legit' review so forgive me. But anyway if you really like tower defence games you will really like this game. And if you havent played tower defence games you really should try this one out! Anyway enjoy some games of Bloons TD Battles!

How to win:  tower loadout: Boomerrang Monkey, Monkey Village, (Tower of your choice) first, but down a boomerrang monkey and updgrade it to bionic boomer. then place a monkey village next to the bionic boomer and upgrade the village to radar scanner. this will let the bionic boomer hit camo bloons. keep placing bionic boomers in the radius of the monkey village. then place the tower of your choice in the radius of the monkey village. the only thing that this loadout cannot help you with is if a ZOMG comes towards you.

Short version: Fun competing against other players. Even more fun competeing against your friends! Micro transactions, but avaoidable. A bit grindy without microtransactions. Competative leaderboards.  Story time! My friend didn't know that you could spawn baloons so i won a fair few games thanks to that. It was hard to not laugh as he was being absolutely swarmed when i was just brushing off a few dozen baloons.

First off, I am no new comer to the game. After playing 30+ on the Android game (both battles and bloon TD 5) I have come to enjoy these games. I was very happy to see the game released on steam and so far I am loving it.  Pros: Easy to learn and enjoy. Ranking seems nice, not too OP matches VS new comers. Hours of gameplay packed into a game with no ending.  Cons: Game gets kinda boring after a while (Fix: Play in short terms, two matches then something else, then come back)   The whole, rechaging energy part (Fix: Don't waste the energy on map skips and such, OR: Follow fix 1.)  The Cobra tower seems, unbalanced. Its like a hack basicly but you can buy/spend your life earning (Fix: Have more stratagy, or just lose and move on)   Your internet pops out for 1 minute and bang. You now have an LOSE on your record. I know it wouldn't be good to not have that, (combat logging) but still. I guess that isnt really a con so I don't have a fix.    Thanks for reading!

If you read my review for BTD5 then you'll get this.
